original_text: In the current CLSVOF method, the normal vector is calculated directly by discretising the LS gradient using a finite difference scheme. By appropriately choosing one of three finite difference schemes (central, forward, or backward differencing), it has been demonstrated that thin liquid ligaments can be well resolved see Xiao (2012). Although a high order discretisation scheme (e.g. 5th order WENO) has been found necessary for LS evolution in pure LS methods to reduce mass error, low order LS discretisation schemes (2nd order is used here) can produce accurate results when the LS equation is solved and constrained as indicated above in a CLSVOF method (see Xiao, 2012), since the VOF method maintains 2nd order accuracy. This is a further reason to adopt the CLSVOF method, which has been used for all the following simulations of liquid jet primary breakup.
original_translation: En el método actual CLSVOF, el vector normal se calcula directamente mediante la discretización del gradiente de LS utilizando un esquema de diferencias finitas. Al elegir adecuadamente uno de los tres esquemas de diferencias finitas (central, hacia adelante o hacia atrás), se ha demostrado que los finos ligamentos líquidos pueden resolverse bien, ver Xiao (2012). Aunque se ha encontrado que un esquema de discretización de alto orden (por ejemplo, WENO de 5º orden) es necesario para la evolución de LS en métodos de LS puros para reducir el error de masa, los esquemas de discretización de LS de bajo orden (se usa 2º orden aquí) pueden producir resultados precisos cuando se resuelve la ecuación de LS y se restringe como se indica arriba en un método CLSVOF (ver Xiao, 2012), ya que el método VOF mantiene una precisión de 2º orden. Esta es otra razón para adoptar el método CLSVOF, que se ha utilizado en todas las simulaciones siguientes de la fragmentación primaria de chorros líquidos.
original_sentences: In the current CLSVOF method, the normal vector is calculated directly by discretising the LS gradient using a finite difference scheme.

By appropriately choosing one of three finite difference schemes (central, forward, or backward differencing), it has been demonstrated that thin liquid ligaments can be well resolved see Xiao (2012).

Although a high order discretisation scheme (e.g. 5th order WENO) has been found necessary for LS evolution in pure LS methods to reduce mass error, low order LS discretisation schemes (2nd order is used here) can produce accurate results when the LS equation is solved and constrained as indicated above in a CLSVOF method (see Xiao, 2012), since the VOF method maintains 2nd order accuracy.
This is a further reason to adopt the CLSVOF method, which has been used for all the following simulations of liquid jet primary breakup.

original_annotated_sentences:
In the current
CLSVOF method
, the normal vector is calculated directly by discretising the LS gradient using a finite difference scheme.

By appropriately choosing one of three finite difference schemes (central, forward, or backward differencing), it has been demonstrated that thin liquid ligaments can be well resolved see Xiao (2012).

Although a high order discretisation scheme (e.g. 5th order WENO) has been found necessary for LS evolution in pure LS methods to reduce mass error, low order LS discretisation schemes (2nd order is used here) can produce accurate results when the LS equation is solved and constrained as indicated above in a
CLSVOF method
(see Xiao, 2012), since the VOF method maintains 2nd order accuracy.

This is a further reason to adopt the
CLSVOF method
, which has been used for all the following simulations of liquid jet primary breakup.

puros para reducir el error de masa, los esquemas de discretización de LS de bajo orden (se utiliza 2º orden aquí) pueden producir resultados precisos cuando la ecuación de LS se resuelve y se restringe como se indica arriba en un método CLSVOF (ver Xiao, 2012), ya que el método VOF mantiene una precisión de 2º orden.
LS methods.translated_text:
En el método actual CLSVOF, el vector normal se calcula directamente mediante la discretización del gradiente de LS utilizando un esquema de diferencias finitas. Al elegir adecuadamente uno de los tres esquemas de diferencias finitas (central, hacia adelante o hacia atrás), se ha demostrado que los finos ligamentos líquidos pueden resolverse bien, ver Xiao (2012). Output: Aunque se ha encontrado que un esquema de discretización de alto orden (por ejemplo, WENO de 5º orden) es necesario para la evolución de LS en métodos de
mínimos cuadrados
puros para reducir el error de masa, los esquemas de discretización de LS de bajo orden (se utiliza 2º orden aquí) pueden producir resultados precisos cuando la ecuación de LS se resuelve y se restringe como se indica arriba en un método CLSVOF (ver Xiao, 2012), ya que el método VOF mantiene una precisión de 2º orden. Esta es otra razón para adoptar el método CLSVOF, que se ha utilizado en todas las simulaciones siguientes de la fragmentación primaria de chorros líquidos.

original_annotated_sentences: In the current CLSVOF method, the normal vector is calculated directly by discretising the LS gradient using a finite difference scheme.

By appropriately choosing one of three finite difference schemes (central, forward, or backward differencing), it has been demonstrated that thin liquid ligaments can be well resolved see Xiao (2012).

Although a high order discretisation scheme (e.g. 5th order WENO) has been found necessary for LS evolution in pure LS methods to
reduce mass error
, low order LS discretisation schemes (2nd order is used here) can produce accurate results when the LS equation is solved and constrained as indicated above in a CLSVOF method (see Xiao, 2012), since the VOF method maintains 2nd order accuracy.
This is a further reason to adopt the CLSVOF method, which has been used for all the following simulations of liquid jet primary breakup.
